gmx:name.gco:CharacterString: Feature catalog for Travel Monitoring Stations: United States, 2014

gmx:scope.gco:CharacterString: Traffic monitoring; Traffic flow; Traffic patterns; Traffic surveys; Statistics; Roads

gfc:definition.gco:CharacterString: state postal code followed by full state name.
This field contains an alphanumeric designation for the station where the survey data are collected.
Longitude of the station location with the west hemisphere assumed and decimal place understood as XXX.XXX XXX
Latitude of the station location with the north hemisphere assumed and decimal place understood as XX.XXX XXX.
direction traffic is traveling at station site
North-South or Northeast-Southwest combined (ATR stations only)
East-West or Southeast-Northwest combined (ATR stations only)
Either each lane is considered a separate station or all lanes in each direction are combined.
principal arterial - other freeways or expressways
Coded number of lanes in one direction at the site. "9" is coded if there are more than eight lanes.
Coded number of lanes in one direction that are monitored at this site. "9" is coded if there are more than eight lanes.
station used for heavy vehicle travel informstion system
station not used for heavy vehicle travel information system
Number coded for number of lanes in one direction that are monitored for vehicle classification at this site. "9" is coded when there are more than eight lanes.
type of input and processing used to classify vehicles.
human observation of vehicle image (e.g., video)
automated interpretation of vehicle image or signature (e.g., video, microwave, sonic)
axle spacing with ASTM standard E1572
axle spacing with scheme F modified
axle spacing and vehicle length algorithm
axle spacing, weight, and vehicle length algorithm
axle spacing and other input(s) not specified above

This indicates the total number of classes in the vehicle classification system. The default value is 13 which indicates the standard FHWA 13 class system (see Appendix 4-C). The other vehicle classification systems are based on the HPMS and the Traffic Monitoring System (TMS) documentation. The value that is used will determine the number of count fields needed on the Vehicle Classification Record. In the following list the numbers in parentheses are from the FHWA 13 class system:
Two classes: non-commercial (classes 1-3) and commercial (classes 4-13) vehicles
Three classes: non-commercial (classes 1-3), single-unit commercial (classes 4-7), combination commercial (classes 8-13) vehicles
Four classes: non-commercial (classes 1-3), single-unit commercial (classes 4-7), single-trailer commercial (classes 8-10), multi-trailer commercial (classes 11-13) vehicles

Five classes as follows: ◦1 of 5 = two-axle, two or four-tire vehicles (classes 1-3); 2 of 5 = buses (class 4); 3 of 5 = single-unit trucks (classes 5-7); 4 of 5 = single trailer combination trucks (classes 8-10); 5 of 5=multiple-trailer combination trucks (classes 11-13)
FHWA's 13 class system plus a class 14 (State or vendor defined)
FHWA's 13 class system plus classes 14 and 15 (State or vendor defined)
Station used for TMG sample and Strategic Highway Research Program (SHRP) Long Term Pavement Performance (LTPP) sample
Station used for SHRP/LTPP sample (but not TMG sample)
Station used for TMG sample (but not SHRP/LTPP sample)
station not used for any of the above
number of lanes in one direction that are monitored for truck weight at this site. "9" is coded when there are more than eight lanes.
method used to calibrate the weighing system, e.g., comparing weight-in-motion and weights from static scales.
Combination of test trucks and trucks from the traffic stream (but not ASTM E1318)
other sample of trucks from the traffic stream
moving average of the steering axle of 3S2s
Code the type of sensor used for traffic detection.
If there are two types of sensors at the station, the second is coded using the same codes as Type of Sensor. Otherwise, "N" is coded.
This field indicates the primary purpose for installing the station and hence which organization is responsible for it and supplies the data.
Enforcement purposes (e.g., speed or weight enforcement)
Operations purposes in support of ITS initiatives
Load data for pavement design or pavement management purposes

The LRS Identification reported in this item for the station is the same as the LRS identification reported in the HPMS for the section of roadway where the station is located. The LRS identification is a 12-character, right justified value. The LRS ID can be alphanumeric, but must not contain blanks; leading zeros must be coded. More information concerning the LRS may be found in Chapter V of the HPMS Field Manual, Linear Referencing System Requirements.

This is the LRS location point for the station. It is similar information to the LRS Beginning Point and LRS Ending Point in the HPMS. The KMPT for the station must be within the range of the LRS beginning point and LRS ending point for the roadway section upon which the station is located. It is coded in kilometers with an implied decimal in the middle: XXX.XXX.
If the site is used in the SHRP/LTPP sample, the SHRP site ID is used here.
if the station replaces another station, the code used here will be the station id that was used previously.
last two digits of the appropriate year if known.
last two digits of the year the station was closed if known.
three-digit FIPS county code (see Federal Information Processing Standards Publication 6, "Counties of the States of the United States").
no, not on an HPMS standard sample section
yes, on an HPMS standard sample section
If the station is on an HPMS standard sample section, the HPMS Sample Identifier per the HPMS Field Manual (Item 47) is used here.
no, not on the national highway system
this is the same as route signing in HPMS Field Manual (item 22)

route number of the principal route on which the station is located. If the station is located on a city street, zero-fill this field. This is the same as Signed Route Number in HPMS Field Manual (Item 24).
Code same as Posted Route Signing for concurrent route if there is one.
Code same as Posted Signed Route Number for concurrent route if there is one.

stations located on a numbered route, the distance and direction of the station from the nearest major intersecting route or state border or landmark on state road maps is coded here. If the station is located on a city street, enter the city and street name. Abbreviate if necessary. Left justify
